sen.j: 七面大明神（しちめんだいみょうじん）は、その昔は七面天女と呼ばれ日蓮宗系において法華経を守護するとされる女神である。
sen.e: Shichimen-daimyojin used to be called Shichimen-tennyo and she is thought to be a goddess who protects Hoke-kyo Sutra (the Lotus Sutra) in Nichiren sect linage.
Shichimen-tennyo is the former name of Shichimen-daimyojin, a goddess whom followers of the Nichiren-shu school of Buddhism believe protects the Lotus Sutra ('Hoke-kyo' in Japanese).
sen.cmt: *Revised for clarityChanged "Nichiren sect" to "Nichiren-shu" to differentiate it from Nichiren Shoshu
sen.e: Shichimen-tennyo is the former name of Shichimen-daimyojin, a goddess whom followers of the Nichiren school of Buddhism believe protects the Lotus Sutra ('Hoke-kyo' in Japanese).
sen.cmt: Nichiren school としました。

sen.j: 七面天女は、当初日蓮宗の総本山である身延山久遠寺の守護神として信仰された。
sen.e: Originally Shichimen-tennyo was worshipped as a guardian god of Minobusan Kuon-ji Temple which is the Sohonzan (head temple of a Buddhist sect) of Nichiren school of Buddhism.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Originally, Shichimen-tennyo was worshipped as the guardian goddess of Minobusan Kuon-ji Temple, the head temple of the Nichiren-shu.
sen.cmt: Revised for clarity
sen.e: Originally, Shichimen-tennyo was worshipped as the guardian goddess of Kuon-ji Temple at Mt. Minobu, the head temple of the Nichiren sect.
sen.cmt: Kuon-ji Temple at Mt. Minobu としました。Nichiren sect としました。

sen.j: やがては日蓮宗が広まるにつれ、法華経を守護する神として各地の日蓮宗寺院で祀られるようになった。
sen.e: Eventually, Shichimen-tennyo came to be enshrined as a god who protects Hoke-kyo Sutra (the Lotus Sutra) at Nichiren sect temples across Japan as Nichiren school become diffused.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Later, as the Nichiren-shu school spread, she came to be enshrined as the goddess who protects the Lotus Sutra at Nichiren-shu temples across Japan.
sen.cmt: Revised for clarity
sen.e: Later, as the Nichiren school spread, she came to be enshrined as the goddess who protects the Lotus Sutra at Nichiren sect temples across Japan.
sen.cmt: Nichiren school, Nichiren sectとしました。

sen.j: その本地は山梨県南巨摩郡早川町にある七面山である。
sen.e: Its honji (original ground or true nature) is Shichimen-san Mountain located in Hayakawa-cho, Minamikoma-gun, Yamanashi Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The original deity is enshrined at Shichimen-san Mountain in Hayakawa-cho, Minamikoma-gun, Yamanashi Prefecture.
sen.cmt: *Revised for clarity -although the translator split this sentence, apart from the fact that the original sentence now makes no mention of "七面山", I think it would be better undivided
sen.e: The original deity is enshrined at Mt. Shichimen in Hayakawa-cho, Minamikoma-gun, Yamanashi Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Mt. Shichimen としました。原文に「七面山」を追加しました。

sen.j: 標高は１９８２ｍの七面山の山頂にある寺（敬慎院）に祀られている神。
sen.e: The goddess is enshrined at a temple (Keishin-in Temple) located at the top of Shichimen-san Mountain, which is 1,982 meters in height.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The goddess is enshrined at a temple (Keishin-in Temple) located at the top of the 1,982-meter mountain.
sen.cmt: Revised for clarity
sen.e: The goddess is enshrined at a temple (Keishin-in Temple) located at the top of Mt. Shichimen, which is 1,982-meter high.
sen.cmt: Mt. Shichimen としました。

sen.j: 伝説によりと日蓮の弟子の日朗と南部實長公が登山して永仁五年九月十九日朝に七面大明神を勧請してといわれている。
sen.e: Legend has it that disciples of Nichiren, Nichiro and Sanenaga NANBU ko climbed the mountain and did kanjo (ceremonial transfer of a divided tutelary deity to a new location) of Shichimen-daimyojin on September 19, 1297.
Legend has it that Nichiro and Lord Sanenaga NANBU, disciples of Nichiren, climbed the mountain and performed the ceremonial division and transfer of Shichimen-daimyojin on September 19, 1297.
sen.cmt: Revised for clarity
sen.e: Legend has it that Nichiro and Lord Sanenaga NANBU, disciples of Nichiren, climbed the mountain and performed the ceremonial division and transfer of Shichimen-daimyojin on the morning of October 13, 1297.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 古来より修験道にて有名な山であり、山頂に大きな池がある。
sen.e: Since ancient times this mountain is famous for Shugendo (Japanese mountain asceticism-shamanism incorporating Shinto and Buddhist concepts) and at the top of mountain has large pond.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since ancient times, this mountain has been famous for Shugendo (Japanese mountain asceticism-shamanism incorporating Shinto and Buddhist concepts) and at the top of the mountain there is a large lake.
sen.cmt: PunctuationTenseArticle"has"→"there is"
sen.e: Since ancient times, this mountain has been famous for Shugendo (Japanese mountain asceticism-shamanism incorporating Shinto and Buddhist concepts) and at the top of the mountain there is a large lake.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そのほとりには池大神が祀られてあるがその姿は役行者の姿である。
sen.e: At the edge of the pond, Ike-no-okami is enshrined, which looks like EN no Gyoja (A semi-legendary holy man noted for his practice of mountain asceticism during the second half of the 7 century).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Ike-no-okami enshrined at the edge of the lake is actually EN no Gyoja (a 7th century holy man said to be the founder of Shugendo).

sen.e: The Ike no Okami enshrined at the edge of the lake is actually EN no Gyoja (a seventh century holy man said to be the founder of Shugendo).
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 身延山に隠棲していて現在の妙石坊の高座石で日蓮の読経と法話を拝聴するために度々現れた若い娘が、実は七面山に棲む竜の変化した姿であり、日蓮の教化により久遠寺の守護神として祀られるようになったという。
sen.e: It is said that a young girl who lived in seclusion in Mt. Minobu often appeared to listen to sutra chanting and Buddhist sermon performed by Nichiren at Koza stone (the stage on which Nitiren sat) of Myosekibo Temple and her real identity was a dragon living in Shichimen-san Mountain, and then she came to be enshrined as a guardian god of Kuon-ji Temple after enlightened by Nichiren.

It is said that a young girl who lived in seclusion on Mt. Minobu, often appeared to listen to sutra chanting and Buddhist sermons performed by Nichiren at the Koza stone (the stage on which Nichiren sat) in Myosekibo Temple; in fact she was a dragon living in Shichimen-san Mountain and she came to be enshrined as the guardian goddess of Kuon-ji Temple after being enlightened by Nichiren.

Shichimen and she came to be enshrined as the guardian goddess of Kuon-ji Temple after being enlightened by Nichiren.
sen.cmt: Mt. Shichimen としました。

sen.j: 七面天女の本体は、竜とも吉祥天とも弁才天とも言われている。
sen.e: The hontai (basic essence) of Shichimen-tennyo is said to be a dragon, Kisshoten (Laksmi), or Benzaiten (Sarasvati, Buddhist goddess of music, learning, eloquence, wealth, longevity, and protection from natural disasters).

The hontai (basic essence) of Shichimen-tennyo is said to be a dragon, Kisshoten (the Japanese version of Laksmi, the Hindu goddess of happiness, fertility, and beauty), or Benzaiten (the Japanese name for Saraswati, the Buddhist goddess of music, learning, eloquence, wealth, longevity, and protection from natural disasters).
sen.cmt: Revised for clarity - added explanation of Kisshoten

sen.cmt: 修正なし
